entries.title: How Ukraine is winning the social media war
entries.description: Despite civilian and military bloodshed, Ukraine's online information war keeps a sense of humour.

entries.title: Dementia: Carer encourages other men to seek support
entries.description: Stefan cares for his wife who has Alzheimer's, but says he and other male carers need to talk more.

entries.title: Maharajah Duleep Singh: Indian boy king's warm friendship with Queen Victoria
entries.description: An exhibition in the UK chronicles the life of Maharajah Duleep Singh, the last Sikh king from India.

entries.title: Opioid crisis: US teens fastest growing group to die
entries.description: Teen deaths from fentanyl overdose rose 20% last year - who is to blame and what can be done?

entries.title: China Party Congress: Xi Jinping to cement grip on power at historic meeting
entries.description: Delegates in Beijing are expected to hand him a historic third term as party leader.

entries.title: Climate change: Can an enormous seaweed farm help curb it?
entries.description: A British businessman believes it could suck a billion tonnes of carbon out of the atmosphere annually.

entries.title: Alex Jones: Will a huge legal award crush his Infowars empire?
entries.description: The talk show host faces severe financial and legal problems, but shows no signs of changing.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Russian's exhausting ordeal to escape conscription
entries.description: This young man calls the Ukraine invasion a 'war against our own people'.

entries.title: Castrating Pablo Escobar's hippos
entries.description: Vet Carlos Valderrama describes castrating Pablo Escobar's hippo in the wild.

entries.title: Home Secretary to crack down on disruptive protests with new bill
entries.description: Protesters could be blocked from targeting key infrastructure under the home secretary's new plans.

entries.title: Claressa Shields v Savannah Marshall: American produces career-best performance in historic fight
entries.description: Claressa Shields beats Savannah Marshall in a fantastic fight on a historic night for women's boxing.

entries.title: Leeds fire: Emergency crews tackle city centre blaze
entries.description: The council leader says the fire is in a former local authority building now in the hands of developers.

entries.title: Chants, shooting and sirens as Iran prison burns
entries.description: In some videos people could be heard outside the prison chanting "death to the dictator".

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: England send sparks flying in Samoa victory
entries.description: England's expectations may have been subdued before hosting their World Cup opener but a rampant victory over Samoa has now heightened their prospects.

entries.title: Best start in 59 years & a 'different animal' - are Antonio Conte's Tottenham side contenders?
entries.description: Arsenal and Manchester City have dominated the headlines so far, but are Tottenham emerging from the shadows under Antonio Conte?

entries.title: Belgorod shooting: Gunmen kill 11 in attack on Russian trainee soldiers
entries.description: Two attackers opened fire on recruits who had volunteered to fight in Ukraine, local media report.

entries.title: Will a new name give Wales' sparkling wine cheers?
entries.description: It may taste good, but the the name Welsh sparkling wine doesn't flow from the tongue at it could.

entries.title: Reece James: England and Chelsea defender set to miss World Cup with knee injury
entries.description: England and Chelsea defender Reece James looks set to miss the World Cup in Qatar with a knee injury.

entries.title: Evin prison fire: Gun shots and sirens heard at notorious detention centre
entries.description: Video appears to show the sky lit up orange as flames are seen behind a tower, and smoke billows.

entries.title: Tottenham Hotspur 2-0 Everton: Spurs close cap on leaders Arsenal
entries.description: Harry Kane marks his 400th Tottenham appearance with a goal as Antonio Conte's side beat Everton at home.

entries.title: Greece: Vehicles dragged into the sea as flash floods hit Crete
entries.description: At least one person is killed as heavy rains hit the Greek island.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Pundits heap praise on England after 10-try win over Samoa
entries.description: BBC pundits heap praise on England after their stunning 60-6 victory over Samoa in their opening World Cup match.

entries.title: James Maddison: Has Leicester's England hopeful failed final World Cup audition?
entries.description: With England boss Gareth Southgate watching Leicester's goalless draw with Crystal Palace, has James Maddison failed his World Cup audition?

entries.title: Kaiser Chiefs silenced at Rugby League World Cup opening ceremony
entries.description: The pre-tournament show is halted just minutes before the opening game between England and Samoa.

entries.title: BioNTech: Could Covid vaccine technology crack cancer?
entries.description: BioNTech's mRNA cancer trials started long before the pandemic, and have shown some early encouraging signals.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: England cruise to victory over Samoa
entries.description: Watch highlights as England cruise to a 60-6 victory over Samoa in the opening game of the Rugby League World Cup at St James's Park.

entries.title: Fulham 2-2 Bournemouth: Cherries stay unbeaten under Gary O'Neil
entries.description: Bournemouth remain unbeaten under interim manager Gary O'Neil following an entertaining 2-2 draw at Craven Cottage.

entries.title: Wolves 1-0 Nottingham Forest: Ruben Neves scores penalty and Brennan Johnson misses penalty
entries.description: Wolves goalkeeper Jose Sa saves a Brennan Johnson penalty after Ruben Neves converts from the spot against Nottingham Forest.

entries.title: Andrew Bailey: Bank of England 'will not hesitate to raise rates' to meet inflation target
entries.description: The Bank's governor says inflationary pressures may require "a stronger response" than originally forecast a couple of months ago.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: England 60-6 Samoa - Welsby, Young, Watkins, Farnworth score
entries.description: Hosts England open the delayed 2021 Rugby League World Cup by ruthlessly taking apart a desperately poor Samoa at St James' Park.

entries.title: Celtic 6-1 Hibernian: Forrest hits hat-trick for rampant champions
entries.description: James Forrest takes his Celtic tally to 100 goals with a hat-trick as the champions demolish hapless Hibs 6-1 in the Scottish Premiership.

entries.title: Mason Greenwood charged with attempted rape and assault
entries.description: Manchester United footballer Mason Greenwood, 21, is due in court on Monday.

entries.title: Bank of England chief warns of fresh interest rate hike
entries.description: Andrew Bailey also describes his conversations with Chancellor Jeremy Hunt as a "meeting of minds".

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Dominic Young double extends England lead
entries.description: England's Dominic Young scores a "try to remember" before adding a second as England extend their lead over Samoa in the World Cup opener.

entries.title: LS Lowry rare Seaburn seascape sells for more than £1m
entries.description: Tennants Auctioneers in Leyburn say Lowry spent time on the North East coast after his mother died.

entries.title: Who is in charge, Liz Truss or Jeremy Hunt?
entries.description: The new chancellor has junked the prime minister's economic strategy in 24 hours, writes Laura Kuenssberg.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Jack Welsby scores 'magic' first try of World Cup
entries.description: England's Jack Welsby finds a "little bit of magic" to score the first try of the Rugby League World Cup against Samoa at St James's Park.

entries.title: Robbie Coltrane was huge in stature and heart, say friends
entries.description: The actor's friends and Harry Potter co-stars pay tribute to his kindness, warmth and sense of humour.

entries.title: Leicester 0-0 Crystal Palace: Goalless draw keeps pressure on beleaguered Brendan Rodgers
entries.description: Leicester City are unable to ease the pressure on manager Brendan Rodgers as they are held to a frustrating goalless draw by Crystal Palace at King Power Stadium.

entries.title: Aston Villa 1-2 West Ham: Hammers end Villa's perfect WSL start
entries.description: West Ham claim their first win since the opening day as Aston Villa drop their first points of the Women's Super League season.

entries.title: Kyiv told to save electricity after Russian missile strike
entries.description: A power installation near Ukraine's capital was heavily damaged by another Russian missile strike.

entries.title: MPs remember Sir David Amess on anniversary of his murder
entries.description: Liz Truss and Keir Starmer lead tributes to late Southend MP while tree is planted in his memory.

entries.title: Creeslough explosion: Creeslough father and child had 'a beautiful love'
entries.description: The funeral of Creeslough victims Robert Garwe and his daughter Shauna Flanagan-Garwe has taken place.

entries.title: Women’s Rugby World Cup: Australia complete comeback to avoid upset against Scotland
entries.description: Watch as Australia avoid a huge upset against Scotland, winning 14-12 despite two late red cards in the Women's Rugby World Cup.

entries.title: Electric Mini production to move to China
entries.description: The first electric Mini was built in Oxford in 2020, but most will now be made in China.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: England victorious but fans given wake-up call by France
entries.description: England's closely fought victory against France is a reality check for fans who expected them to win the World Cup easily.

entries.title: Mason Greenwood arrest: Man United player in alleged bail breach
entries.description: Mason Greenwood is held for allegedly breaching bail after his previous arrest on suspicion of rape.

entries.title: Senior Tory MP Tobias Ellwood readmitted to parliamentary party
entries.description: Tobias Ellwood tweeted that he was "off the naughty step" and back in the parliamentary party.

entries.title: Miriam Margolyes swears live on air while discussing Jeremy Hunt
entries.description: The actress told the BBC's Today programme she greeted the new chancellor, but wanted to say something else.

entries.title: Ivan Toney: Brentford condemn racist abuse towards striker
entries.description: Brentford have condemned the "disgusting, racist abuse" faced by striker Ivan Toney after his two goals in Friday's 2-0 win against Brighton.

entries.title: My life is on pause until I'm old enough to get my pension
entries.description: Linda Jeffrey had to give up work after her husband died last year and now has to rely on food banks.

entries.title: Train Like A Pro: Tackles and high balls with Jamaica's Rugby League World Cup team
entries.description: BBC Sport's Liam Loftus learns how to train like a professional rugby league player with two of Jamaica’s World Cup 'Reggae Warriors' - Michael Lawrence and Ben Jones-Bishop.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: France 7-13 England - Red Roses claim statement win
entries.description: England continue their successful start to the World Cup with a 13-7 victory against a determined France in New Zealand.

entries.title: Three women charged after Just Stop Oil protests
entries.description: Police charge three people after a New Scotland Yard sign and a Van Gogh painting were defaced.

entries.title: Jeremy Hunt: We need to make difficult decisions
entries.description: Jeremy Hunt has told the BBC that his predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng made two mistakes in the mini-budget.

entries.title: Claressa Shields v Savannah Marshall: Origins of a 10-year feud unlikely to end on Saturday night
entries.description: BBC Sport delves into the origins of Savannah Marshall's 10-year rivalry with Claressa Shields, speaking to both women and looking back at their first fight in 2012.

entries.title: Claressa Shields v Savannah Marshall: Shields will knock out Marshall as 'it means more' to her
entries.description: Two-time undisputed champion Claressa Shields believes Saturday's middleweight title fight means more to her than opponent Savannah Marshall.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: Scotland 12-14 Australia
entries.description: Scotland fall to a second Rugby World Cup defeat after a heartbreaking 14-12 loss against Australia in Whangarei.

entries.title: Amanda Todd: Dutchman sentenced for fatal cyber-stalking
entries.description: He showed no remorse in court as he learned his fate for tormenting the girl whose ordeal shocked Canada.

entries.title: Ancient eel migration mystery unravelled
entries.description: Eels are tracked to the Sargasso Sea on an epic migration, helping in their conservation.

entries.title: Sir David Amess anniversary: Southend should go for City of Culture, says MP
entries.description: The successor to Sir David Amess says Southend should seek City of Culture status in his honour.

entries.title: Coronation bank holiday faces local elections clash in England
entries.description: A Friday bank holiday for King Charles's coronation would clash with vote counting in England.
